Proficiency in Java & Front-End Web Development.

Check Out My Resume

I Specialize In

Building small to medium scale Java programs, and in developing and deploying websites on the front-end.

Java

The powerful scent of coffee... Wait a minute not that kind of Java! I've worked with the Java programming language for over a year now, and I feel comfortable with my ability to create small to medium scale programs utilizing principles of objected-oriented programming.

HTML5

I have been reteaching myself HTML5 through an online course. Learning about different HTML elements and how they can be used has allowed me to build some neat websites. Check out my resume section to view two projects I've worked on that showcase HTML5 in action.

CSS3

If you read the HTML5 section, then I also learned CSS3 alongside in the online course. CSS3 is very powerful in creating perfectly aligned content and styling up HTML elements with nice-looking font and colors. This portfolio website exhibits those very capabilities.

My Design Process

All of my projects are derived from imagination and brought to life by the skills in my coding toolbox.

Find A Theme

In my search for a theme I usually look for inspirational words or nostalgic imagery online which induces my creative motor to start brainstorming.

Gather Data

After I find a core idea to work on, I look to gather a small sample of data, relevant information, or images I need before I start actual work on the project.

Structure Project

Structuring my project makes it easy to navigate around and make changes. It allows me to embrace a consistent style throughout the project for my content.

Revise Code

I like to make sure there are no noticeable errors, bugs, or style issues that could impede the project. This part of the process is usually the most time consuming.
